Environmental Protection Agency.Description: The Environmental Protection Agency implements and enforces regulations under the Clean Air Act to protect air quality and reduce pollution.

The Environmental Protection Agency implements and enforces regulations under the National Environmental Policy Act to ensure that federal agencies consider the environmental impacts of their actions.

The Environmental Protection Agency oversees the Superfund program, which is responsible for cleaning up hazardous waste sites and protecting human health and the environment from the risks posed by these sites.
The Environmental Protection Agency implements and enforces regulations under the Clean Water Act to protect and restore the quality of the nation's waters.
